meanings.definition: To make up for a deficiency
meanings.sent1: She redeems her mistake by apologizing sincerely.
meanings.sent2: He redeems his low score by studying harder for the next test.
meanings.sent3: The kind gesture redeems the forgotten birthday gift.
meanings.sent4: Her smile redeems even the gloomiest of days.
meanings.sent5: The extra effort she put in redeems her previous errors.

meanings.sent1: The hero redeems the villain by showing forgiveness.
meanings.sent2: The priest believes that faith redeems all who seek redemption.
meanings.sent3: His good deeds redeem his past wrongdoings.
meanings.sent4: Love has the power to redeem even the darkest souls.
meanings.sent5: The act of kindness redeems the lost soul from despair.

meanings.definition: To fulfill a promise or obligation
meanings.sent1: He redeems his pledge by delivering on time.
meanings.sent2: She always redeems her commitment to help others.
meanings.sent3: The timely completion of the project redeems his word.
meanings.sent4: His honesty redeems his reputation in the community.
meanings.sent5: The fulfilled vow redeems his honor in the eyes of others.
